translated: “Various kinds” means many kinds.

original: ma byas pa'i phyir byas pa dang / ma byas pa'i phyir ma byas pa gtong pa lhag par spyod par byed na'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa'i phyir byas pa dang / ma byas pa'i phyir ma byas pa gtong pa lhag par spyod par byed na'o //
translated: “If he engages in” means if he engages in the act of lending, the act of borrowing, the act of usury, the act of giving credit, the act of doing something for a fee, the act of not doing something for a fee, the act of doing something for free, and the act of not doing something for free.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “A minor infraction” is as explained above.

original: de la spang ba snga ma dang / 'di dang 'og ma gsum gyis yul la bye brag ni 'di yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la spang ba snga ma dang / 'di dang 'og ma gsum gyis yul la bye brag ni 'di yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The first and the following three are to be understood as the distinctions of the object.

original: snga ma ni rin po che la sogs pa la reg pas so //
analyzed: snga ma ni rin po che la sogs pa la reg pas so //
translated: The first is by touching jewels, etc.

original: 'di ni khe spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis pa na dang rin po che la sogs pa spyod pa las so //
analyzed: 'di ni khe spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis pa na dang rin po che la sogs pa spyod pa las so //
translated: This is by using money and jewels, etc. out of desire for profit.

original: 'og ma ni gang yang rung bas rnyed pa 'dod cing nyo tshong la sogs pas spyod pa las skyed phyin na'o //
analyzed: 'og ma ni gang yang rung bas rnyed pa 'dod cing nyo tshong la sogs pas spyod pa las skyed phyin na'o //
translated: The following is by using any of these out of desire for gain and by buying and selling, etc.

original: de ltar bye brag bstan nas de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar bye brag bstan nas de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the distinctions, here the actual basis of the downfall is presented as follows.

original: dge slong gis rnyed pa 'dod pas pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid la pa na dang rin po ches spyod pa las skyed phyin na /
analyzed: dge slong gis rnyed pa 'dod pas pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid la pa na dang rin po ches spyod pa las skyed phyin na /
translated: If a monk, out of desire for gain, uses money and jewels with a householder who is not a relative,

original: skyed de las mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyed de las mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then he has the actual basis of the downfall of using conspicuous behavior.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / pa na dang rin po ches spyod pa dang / skyed phyin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / pa na dang rin po ches spyod pa dang / skyed phyin pa nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this is one who desires gain, the other is a layperson, he is not a relative, he is one who deals in cloth and jewels, and he is one who has completed the transaction.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there is a downfall of the main part by five limbs:

original: rnyed pa 'dod pa dang pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / pa na dang rin po ches spyod pa dang / skyed phyin pa'o //🔽de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod pa dang pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / pa na dang rin po ches spyod pa dang / skyed phyin pa'o // de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: desiring gain, the other is a layperson, he is not a relative, he is one who deals in cloth and jewels, and he is one who has completed the transaction.

original: mngon mtshan @106a * //
analyzed: mngon mtshan @106a * //
translated: If any of these limbs is missing, there is an offense corresponding to the missing limb.

original: can gyi spyod pa'i spang ba ste bcu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: can gyi spyod pa'i spang ba ste bcu dgu pa'o /
translated: The nineteenth downfall concerns conspicuous behavior.

original: // / nyo tshong byed spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / nyo tshong byed spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The basis for the downfall of engaging in buying and selling is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī,

original: rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde dag nye tshong rnam pa sna tshogs byed de /🔽len par byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde dag nye tshong rnam pa sna tshogs byed de / len par byed /
translated: At that time, the group of six monks engaged in various kinds of commerce.🔽They took in.

original: gtong bar byed /
analyzed: gtong bar byed /
translated: They gave out.

original: nyo bar byed /
analyzed: nyo bar byed /
translated: They bought.🔽They sold.

original: 'tshong bar byed pas gzhan mu stegs can dag snga ma bzhin du smod par byed /
analyzed: 'tshong bar byed pas gzhan mu stegs can dag snga ma bzhin du smod par byed /
translated: As before, the non-Buddhist sectarians criticized them,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: ridiculed them, and spread it about.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: Then the Blessed One, as before,

original: yang dge slong gang nyo tshong rnam pas na tshogs byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang nyo tshong rnam pas na tshogs byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: laid down a rule that any monk who engaged in commerce would commit an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The person was the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni dge slong gi tshul ma yin pa byed 'dod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni dge slong gi tshul ma yin pa byed 'dod pa /
translated: The affliction was the desire to act in a way that was not in keeping with the way of a monk.

original: nyes ba ni nyo tshong rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes ba ni nyo tshong rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa'o //
translated: The offense was engaging in various kinds of commerce.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for the phrase “any monk,”

original: drug sde dag gam gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: drug sde dag gam gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The group of six monks or anyone else like them.

original: nyo tshong zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba rnyed pa 'dod cing nyo tshong byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyo tshong zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba rnyed pa 'dod cing nyo tshong byed pa'o //
translated: “Trading” means buying and selling anything with the desire for profit.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma'o //
translated: “Various” means many kinds.

original: byed na zhes bya ba ni len par byed pa dang / gtong par byed pa dang / nyo bar byed pa dang / 'tshong bar byed pa dag lhag par spyod par byed na'o //
analyzed: byed na zhes bya ba ni len par byed pa dang / gtong par byed pa dang / nyo bar byed pa dang / 'tshong bar byed pa dag lhag par spyod par byed na'o //
translated: “If he engages in” means if he engages in receiving, giving, buying, or selling.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “A downfall that requires confession” is as explained above.

original: nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba 'di ni sngar mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa'i spang ba bstan pa'i bye brag yin te /
analyzed: nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba 'di ni sngar mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa'i spang ba bstan pa'i bye brag yin te /
translated: This downfall that requires confession for engaging in trading is a specific case of the previously explained downfall that requires confession for engaging in conspicuous behavior.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan thams cad ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan thams cad ni 'dra'o //
translated: All the other characteristics are the same.

original: bye brag tu na spang ba snga ma gnyis dang / 'di dang gsum gyi yul la khyad par ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: bye brag tu na spang ba snga ma gnyis dang / 'di dang gsum gyi yul la khyad par ni 'di yod de /
translated: The difference between the first two downfalls and this one is as follows.

original: gser dngul la reg pa'i spang ba ni /
analyzed: gser dngul la reg pa'i spang ba ni /
translated: The downfall that requires confession for handling gold and silver

original: rin po che la sogs pa la reg pa las so //🔽mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa'i spang ba ni /
analyzed: rin po che la sogs pa la reg pa las so // mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa'i spang ba ni /
translated: It is from touching precious substances and so on.

original: khe spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis pa na dang / rin po che la sogs pa las so //🔽nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba ni /
analyzed: khe spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis pa na dang / rin po che la sogs pa las so // nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba ni /
translated: The downfall is accrued by a monk who, out of desire for profit, engages in trade involving precious substances and so on.

original: gang yang rung bas rnyed pa 'dod cing nyo tshong la sogs pas spyod pa las skyed phyin na'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung bas rnyed pa 'dod cing nyo tshong la sogs pas spyod pa las skyed phyin na'o //
translated: The downfall of engaging in trade is accrued by a monk who, out of desire for profit, engages in trade and so on.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽dge slong gis rnyed pa 'dod pas /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni / dge slong gis rnyed pa 'dod pas /
translated: The actual downfalls are presented here as follows.🔽A monk who, out of desire for profit, engages in trade and so on with a layperson who is not a relative.

original: pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid la nyo tshong @106b la sogs pas spyod pa las skyed phyin na skyed de las nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid la nyo tshong @106b la sogs pas spyod pa las skyed phyin na skyed de las nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The actual downfall of engaging in trade is accrued when the monk has made a profit from the transaction.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / nyo tshong gis spyad pa dang / skyed phyin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / nyo tshong gis spyad pa dang / skyed phyin pa nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this is one who desires gain, the other person is a layperson, he is not a relative, he uses it for trade, and he has received the profit.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the basis is a downfall by the five limbs.

original: rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / nyo tshong gis spyad pa dang / skyed phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / nyo tshong gis spyad pa dang / skyed phyin pa'o //
translated: The desire for gain, the other person is a layperson, he is not a relative, he uses it for trade, and he has received the profit.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these limbs is missing, then it is a downfall in the Hīnayāna, as appropriate.

original: nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba ste nyi shu pa'o /
analyzed: nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba ste nyi shu pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-first downfall.

original: // / sdom la /
analyzed: // / sdom la /
translated: The summary:

original: lhung bzed gnyis dang tha ga gnyis //
analyzed: lhung bzed gnyis dang tha ga gnyis //
translated: Two alms bowls, two weavers,🔽Taking what is given, the last autumn month,🔽The wilderness, large robes,

original: byin phrogs ston zla tha chungs dang // dgon pa pa dang ras chen dang // bsngos pa dang ni gsog 'jog go //
analyzed: byin phrogs ston zla tha chungs dang // dgon pa pa dang ras chen dang // bsngos pa dang ni gsog 'jog go //
translated: What is dedicated, and hoarding.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcu pa gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcu pa gsum pa yin te /
translated: This is the third of the ten chapters,

original: sdom la zhes bya ba'i dgos pa dang / tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom la zhes bya ba'i dgos pa dang / tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The purpose of the summary is the same as before.

original: bcu pa gsum pa 'dis kyang spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /🔽lhung bzed 'chang ba dang / lhung bzed tshol ba dang / 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / 'thag pa skyed pa dang / 'phrogs pa dang / brtad pa las byung ba dang / zhag bdun gyis 'bral ba dang / dbyar gyi ras chen dang / bsngos pa las bsgyur ba dang /
analyzed: bcu pa gsum pa 'dis kyang spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te / lhung bzed 'chang ba dang / lhung bzed tshol ba dang / 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / 'thag pa skyed pa dang / 'phrogs pa dang / brtad pa las byung ba dang / zhag bdun gyis 'bral ba dang / dbyar gyi ras chen dang / bsngos pa las bsgyur ba dang /
translated: This third chapter of ten also teaches the ten downfalls that require relinquishment.

original: gsog 'jog go //
analyzed: gsog 'jog go //
translated: They are: keeping an extra alms bowl, seeking an alms bowl, having a robe made, making a robe for someone else, stealing, taking by theft, being separated from one’s robe for more than six nights, the rainy season robe, changing what has been designated, and storing.🔽Keeping an extra alms bowl

original: de la lhung bzed 'chang ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: de la lhung bzed 'chang ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin story for the downfall of keeping an extra alms bowl

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī,

original: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: in Prince Jeta’s grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde dag lhung bzed rnyed do cog sogs par byed cing /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde dag lhung bzed rnyed do cog sogs par byed cing /
translated: At that time, the group of six monks collected every alms bowl they received.

original: bdag nyid kyang spyod par mi byed dge slong gzhan dag la yang sbyin par mi byed nas /🔽dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag lhung bzed rnyed do cog stsogs par byed cing bdag nyid kyang spyod par mi byed /🔽dge slong gzhan dag la yang sbyin par mi byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang spyod par mi byed dge slong gzhan dag la yang sbyin par mi byed nas / dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag lhung bzed rnyed do cog stsogs par byed cing bdag nyid kyang spyod par mi byed / dge slong gzhan dag la yang sbyin par mi byed ces smod par byed /
translated: He himself did not use it, and he did not give it to other monks.🔽“Why do monks who have few wants collect all the almsbowls they can find, and then neither use them themselves nor give them to other monks?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: They disparaged, criticized, and complained and said, “How can monks do this?”

original: dge slong rnams gyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: dge slong rnams gyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: dge slong gis ltung bzed lhag pa zhag bcu'i bar du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis ltung bzed lhag pa zhag bcu'i bar du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One decreed, “Monks, you should keep an extra almsbowl for ten days.

original: de las 'das par 'chang @107a * //
analyzed: de las 'das par 'chang @107a * //
translated: If you keep it longer than that,

original: na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: you commit an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The people were the group of six monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni dge sbyong gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa byed 'dod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni dge sbyong gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa byed 'dod pa /
translated: The affliction was the desire to do what is not in accordance with the Dharma of monastics.

original: nyes pa ni lhung bzed lhag pa zhag bcu las 'das par bcangs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni lhung bzed lhag pa zhag bcu las 'das par bcangs pa'o //
translated: The offense is keeping an extra alms bowl for more than ten days.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
translated: “A monk” means a monk in this dharma.

original: lhung bzed lhag pa zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab par byas pa las lhag pa'o //🔽zhag bcu'i bar du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag pa zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab par byas pa las lhag pa'o // zhag bcu'i bar du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “An extra alms bowl” means one that is more than what has been consecrated.

original: nyin mtshan bcu'i mtha'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan bcu'i mtha'i bar du'o //
translated: “For ten days” means up to the end of ten days and nights.

original: bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba'o //
translated: “One should keep it” means one should possess it.

original: de las 'das par 'chang na zhes bya ba ni de las thal bar 'chang na'o //
analyzed: de las 'das par 'chang na zhes bya ba ni de las thal bar 'chang na'o //
translated: “If he keeps it beyond that” means if he keeps it beyond that.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “A pārājika offense” is as explained above.

original: de la lhung bzed 'chang ba spang ba 'di'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la lhung bzed 'chang ba spang ba 'di'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The definition of this downfall is as follows.

original: sngar gos 'chang ba'i spang ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang thams cad 'dra ste /
analyzed: sngar gos 'chang ba'i spang ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang thams cad 'dra ste /
translated: It is the same as the definition of the downfall of keeping extra robes.

original: bye brag tu na sngar gos zhes smos pa'i gnas su 'dir lhung bzed zhes bya ba'i ming gzhug par bya ba dang / sngar 'khor gsum khebs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes smos pa'i gnas su /
analyzed: bye brag tu na sngar gos zhes smos pa'i gnas su 'dir lhung bzed zhes bya ba'i ming gzhug par bya ba dang / sngar 'khor gsum khebs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes smos pa'i gnas su /
translated: In the place where “having the characteristic of covering the three areas” was mentioned above,

original: 'dir byin gyis brlab tu rung ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i mtha'i tshad dang ldan pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir byin gyis brlab tu rung ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i mtha'i tshad dang ldan pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: here “having the measure of the small, medium, or large limit that is suitable for consecration” should be stated.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the presentation of the basic downfall is this:

original: dge slong gis rang gis lhung bzed byin gyis brlab tu rung ba /
analyzed: dge slong gis rang gis lhung bzed byin gyis brlab tu rung ba /
translated: A monk has a begging bowl that is suitable for consecration,

original: chung ngu'am / 'bring ngam /
analyzed: chung ngu'am / 'bring ngam /
translated: whether small, medium,

original: chen po'i mtha'i tshad dang ldan pa yod la /
analyzed: chen po'i mtha'i tshad dang ldan pa yod la /
translated: or having the measure of the large limit.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs par zhag bcur rjes su zhugs pa nyid yin pa /
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs par zhag bcur rjes su zhugs pa nyid yin pa /
translated: If, without consecrating it, he uses it for ten days,

original: zhag bcu gcig pa'i skya rengs dang po shar na /
analyzed: zhag bcu gcig pa'i skya rengs dang po shar na /

analyzed: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: They should be kept until the end of the rainy season, for half a month afterward.

original: gal te dge slong gis so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus pa'i sngon rol du /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus pa'i sngon rol du /
translated: If a monk, before one month of spring remains,

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen tshol bar byed dam /
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen tshol bar byed dam /
translated: seeks the rainy season robes,

original: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed las 'das par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed las 'das par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: or keeps them for more than half a month after the end of the rainy season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: yul ni @115b mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni @115b mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po //
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po //
translated: The individuals are many monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
translated: The affliction is any one of the three.

original: nyes pa ni dbyar gyi gos ras chen ha cang sngar tshol ba dang / ha cang yun ring du 'char bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dbyar gyi gos ras chen ha cang sngar tshol ba dang / ha cang yun ring du 'char bar byed pa'o //
translated: The action is seeking the rainy season robes too early, or keeping them too long.

original: de la ge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: de la ge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
translated: “A monk” means a monk in this dharma.

original: so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus na zhes bya ba ni zla ba gcig na dbyar nye bar bsgrub pa 'byung bar 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus na zhes bya ba ni zla ba gcig na dbyar nye bar bsgrub pa 'byung bar 'gyur na'o //
translated: “When one month of summer remains” means when one month remains until the beginning of the rainy season.

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen zhes bya ba ni chas 'bab pa'i gos so //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen zhes bya ba ni chas 'bab pa'i gos so //
translated: “A rainy season robe” means a robe made from cloth that is available during the rainy season.

original: btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan las so //
analyzed: btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan las so //
translated: “Should seek” means from others.

original: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed kyi bar du'o //
translated: “Should keep it until the end of the rainy season and the end of the half-month following it” means until the end of the half-month following the ending of the rainy season.

original: gal te dge slong gis so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus pa'i sngon rol du dbyar gyi gos ras chen tshol bar byed dam zhes bya ba ni de'i mdun rol du'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus pa'i sngon rol du dbyar gyi gos ras chen tshol bar byed dam zhes bya ba ni de'i mdun rol du'o //
translated: “If, before one month of summer remains, a monk seeks a rainy season robe” means before that time.

original: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed las 'das par 'chang na zhes bya ba ni de las 'das par ro //
analyzed: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed las 'das par 'chang na zhes bya ba ni de las 'das par ro //
translated: “If he keeps it until after the end of the rainy season and the end of the half-month following it” means if he keeps it beyond that time.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “An offense entailing relinquishment and confession” is as already explained.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the actual basis of the downfall is defined as follows.

original: dge slong bdag nyid dbyar gnas pa snga ma'am phyi ma gan du khas blangs pa'i de'i mdun rol gyi zla ba gcig pas snga rol du /
analyzed: dge slong bdag nyid dbyar gnas pa snga ma'am phyi ma gan du khas blangs pa'i de'i mdun rol gyi zla ba gcig pas snga rol du /
translated: A monk who has accepted either the earlier or later rainy season retreat must, before the one-month period prior to the retreat,

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba tshol lam /🔽dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed las 'das par dbyar gyi gos ras chen 'chang na /
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba tshol lam / dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed las 'das par dbyar gyi gos ras chen 'chang na /
translated: seek out the proper rainy season robe.🔽If he keeps the rainy season robe for more than half a month after the lifting of the restrictions,

original: dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: he commits the actual downfall of keeping the rainy season robe.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this downfall is

original: dbyar nas par khas blangs pa'i zla ba gcig gi sngon rol du tshol ba dang / dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og tu bzla ba phyed 'das par 'chang ba dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: dbyar nas par khas blangs pa'i zla ba gcig gi sngon rol du tshol ba dang / dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og tu bzla ba phyed 'das par 'chang ba dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba nyid do //
translated: a monk who seeks out the rainy season robe before the one-month period prior to the retreat, who keeps it for more than half a month after the lifting of the restrictions, and who has the proper rainy season robe.

original: 'di la tsho ba dan 'chang ba'i dus gnyi ga la yan lag gsum gyis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la tsho ba dan 'chang ba'i dus gnyi ga la yan lag gsum gyis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this case, the actual downfall is incurred by both the seeking and the keeping, each of which has three branches.

original: dbyar gnas par khas len pa'i zla ba gcig gi sngon rol gyi dus dang / de btsal ba grub ba dang / dbyar gi gos ras chen rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas len pa'i zla ba gcig gi sngon rol gyi dus dang / de btsal ba grub ba dang / dbyar gi gos ras chen rung ba nyid do //
translated: the time is after the rainy season retreat has been performed,🔽and the cloth is suitable for the rainy season retreat.🔽The time is the half month after the end of the rainy season retreat,🔽the cloth is suitable for the rainy season retreat,

original: dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og rol gyi zla ba phyed kyi dus dang / de la 'das par 'chang ba dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og rol gyi zla ba phyed kyi dus dang / de la 'das par 'chang ba dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba nyid do //
translated: and it is held over the time limit.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these are not complete, then the rainy season retreat is not valid.

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi sbang ba ste nyi shu brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi sbang ba ste nyi shu brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-eighth training rule, on the rainy season retreat.

original: // / bsngos pa las bsgyur pa'i spang bi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / bsngos pa las bsgyur pa'i spang bi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The training rule on changing what has been designated

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /🔽rgyal byed kyi @116a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na / rgyal byed kyi @116a * //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed in Śrāvastī,

original: tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.🔽A certain alms-goer had a householder go for refuge and take the precepts,

original: bsod snyoms pa zhig gis khyim bdag cig skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bzhag ste /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa zhig gis khyim bdag cig skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bzhag ste /
translated: and he designated a robe for him.

original: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun ngag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / khyim bdag des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod la spyan drang zhing ras zung cig yon dbul bar bsngos te /
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun ngag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / khyim bdag des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod la spyan drang zhing ras zung cig yon dbul bar bsngos te /
translated: The householder had dedicated the merit of inviting the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to a meal and offering a pair of garments to the Buddha.

original: nye dags thos nas des rang la sgyur du bcug ste /
analyzed: nye dags thos nas des rang la sgyur du bcug ste /
translated: Udayī heard about this and had the householder change the dedication to himself.

original: de'i 'og tu khyim bdag des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rang gi khyim du chos ston gsol nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khyim bdag des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rang gi khyim du chos ston gsol nas /
translated: Later, the householder invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to his house to teach the Dharma.

original: ras zung de rgan pa'i mtha' logs su rjes su yi rang bar mdzod cig ces /🔽rjes su yi rang bar byed du bcug nas /
analyzed: ras zung de rgan pa'i mtha' logs su rjes su yi rang bar mdzod cig ces / rjes su yi rang bar byed du bcug nas /
translated: He said to the senior monk, “Please rejoice in this pair of garments.”🔽He had the senior monk rejoice in the gift,

original: nye dga' la byin nas /
analyzed: nye dga' la byin nas /
translated: and then he gave the garments to Udayī.

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag bdag la sgyur du 'jug ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag bdag la sgyur du 'jug ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why do monks with few desires criticize monks, saying, ‘When they know that the goods belong to the saṅgha, why do they have the goods given to individuals?’”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They complain and insult them.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: At that time,

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: the monks reported to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: Then the Blessed One, as before,

original: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag bdag la sgyur du 'jud na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag bdag la sgyur du 'jud na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: made a rule: “Any monk who, knowing that an acquisition has been dedicated to the Saṅgha, causes it to be diverted to himself commits a pāyattika offense.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga' / nyon mongs pa ni brnab sems /
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga' / nyon mongs pa ni brnab sems /
translated: The person was Upasena. The affliction was covetousness.

original: nyes pa ni gzhan gyis gzhan la bsngos pa'i gos gang zag la sgyur du 'jud pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gzhan gyis gzhan la bsngos pa'i gos gang zag la sgyur du 'jud pa'o //
translated: The offense was causing another to divert to himself the robe that had been dedicated to another.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /🔽gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am / gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Any monk” means the Śākya son Upasena or anyone else like him.

original: dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la'o //
translated: “The Saṅgha” means the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s disciples.

original: bsngos pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang zag pa'i'o //
analyzed: bsngos pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang zag pa'i'o //
translated: “Dedicated” means dedicated to the Saṅgha.

original: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa gnyis te /
translated: “Acquisition” means there are two kinds of acquisitions:

original: gos kyi rnyed pa dang / zas kyi rnyed pa ste //
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa dang / zas kyi rnyed pa ste //
translated: the acquisition of robes, and the acquisition of food.

original: don 'dir ni gos kyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gos kyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: In this case, the intended meaning is the acquisition of robes.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Intentionally” means

original: bdag nyid kyis de shes par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis de shes par gyur pa'am /
translated: that one has understood it oneself,

original: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
translated: or that it has been stated by others.

original: gang zag bdag la sgyur du 'jud na zhas bya ba ni bdag nyid la dbul du 'jud na'o //
analyzed: gang zag bdag la sgyur du 'jud na zhas bya ba ni bdag nyid la dbul du 'jud na'o //
translated: “ If one causes a person to give to oneself” means if one causes a person to give to oneself.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “ A downfall that requires confession” is as explained above.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽dge slong gis yon bdag gzhan gyis gang zag dge slong gzhan nam /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni / dge slong gis yon bdag gzhan gyis gang zag dge slong gzhan nam /
translated: Here, the basic downfall is defined as follows.🔽If a monk obtains a robe that has been dedicated to another donor,

original: dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i gos rnyed pa shin @116b tu bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob na /
analyzed: dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i gos rnyed pa shin @116b tu bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob na /
translated: to another monk, or to the saṅgha, and he causes it to be given to himself,

original: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then he has the basic downfall of “changing a dedication.”

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this downfall is

original: gzhan gyis gzhan la bsngos pa'i gos kyi rnyed pa dang / shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan la bsngos pa'i gos kyi rnyed pa dang / shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob pa'o //
translated: The property of a robe that is dedicated to another person, and that is obtained by oneself after knowingly diverting it to oneself.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the basis is a downfall by the five limbs:🔽a donor who is another person,

original: yon bdag gzhan gang yang rung ba dang / gang zag dge slong gzhan nam /
analyzed: yon bdag gzhan gang yang rung ba dang / gang zag dge slong gzhan nam /
translated: a monk who is another person,🔽the Sangha to whom it is dedicated,🔽the property of a robe,

original: dge 'dun la bsngos pa dang / gos kyi rnyed pa dang / shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur ba dang thob pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bsngos pa dang / gos kyi rnyed pa dang / shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur ba dang thob pa'o //
translated: and obtaining it after knowingly diverting it to oneself.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these limbs is missing, then the downfall is a serious transgression, as appropriate.

original: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-ninth downfall, the downfall of diverting a dedication.

original: // / gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin story of the downfall of hoarding

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal ka lan da ka'i gnas na gzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal ka lan da ka'i gnas na gzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana on the outskirts of Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa'i nye gnas dge slong dag sman gang dag de nas lag nyar blangs pa dang / de las byin len byas pa dang / zas kyi phye dang 'dres pa dang / phan tshun 'dres pa dag gi rgyud kyi myags pa gang dag rnam par dbyer mi mngon /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa'i nye gnas dge slong dag sman gang dag de nas lag nyar blangs pa dang / de las byin len byas pa dang / zas kyi phye dang 'dres pa dang / phan tshun 'dres pa dag gi rgyud kyi myags pa gang dag rnam par dbyer mi mngon /
translated: At that time, the monks who were the students and pupils of the venerable Pilindavatsa took medicines that were held in the hand, that were received from the hand, that were mixed with food, and that were mixed with each other, and the decay in their continuums was not apparent.

original: de dag dus su yang za bar byed /
analyzed: de dag dus su yang za bar byed /
translated: They ate them at the proper time

original: dus ma yin par yang za bar byed cing /
analyzed: dus ma yin par yang za bar byed cing /
translated: and at the improper time.🔽They did not see any reason to distinguish between what was to be eaten and what was not to be eaten.

original: de dag la bza' bar rnam par dbye bar yang mi mthong nas dge slong don nyung du dag smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: de dag la bza' bar rnam par dbye bar yang mi mthong nas dge slong don nyung du dag smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: A few monks criticized them,

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: scolding them and saying uncomplimentary things about them.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: Then the Blessed One, as before,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong na ba rnams la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong na ba rnams la /
translated: the Blessed One said to the sick monks,🔽“Monks, I allow you to eat the five things that are not normally eaten:

original: phan ba so sor bsten par bya ba'i sman gang dag bka' stsal pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phan ba so sor bsten par bya ba'i sman gang dag bka' stsal pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The medicine that is to be used for one’s own benefit that he has allowed is as follows:

original: zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang ; sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba da dag las dge slong na bas 'dod na /
analyzed: zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang ; sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba da dag las dge slong na bas 'dod na /
translated: clarified butter, oil, honey, and sugar. If a monk is sick,

original: rang gis zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: rang gis zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: he may, if he wishes, consecrate it for seven days.

original: gsog 'jog gi yongs su longs spyod pas yongs su longs spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi yongs su longs spyod pas yongs su longs spyod par bya'o //
translated: He may use it by using it up.

original: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyod par byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyod par byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If he uses it beyond that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The place is Rājagṛha.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dge slong dag /
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dge slong dag /
translated: The individuals are the monks who were the co-resident disciples and the resident disciples of Venerable Pilindavatsa.

original: nyon mongs pa ni lto 'dun che ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni lto 'dun che ba /
translated: The affliction is strong desire for food.

original: nyes pa ni gsog 'jog byed pa'o //🔽de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyes pa ni gsog 'jog byed pa'o // de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The offense is storing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis so //
translated: The Blessed One is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: dge slong @117a * //

analyzed: brdzun du smra ba dang / skyon nas smra ba dang / phra ma byed pa dang / skyo sdogs byed pa dang / ston pa dang / 'don pa dang gnas ngan len brjod pa dang / mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa dang / khyad du gsong pa'o //
translated: They are: lying, backbiting, slander, nagging, teaching, reciting, expressing faults, expressing the higher human qualities, denigrating, and despising.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ltung byed kyi chos dgu bcu po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni ltung byed gdon pa 'di'i lung dbog pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ltung byed kyi chos dgu bcu po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni ltung byed gdon pa 'di'i lung dbog pa bstan to //
translated: The venerable ones, these ninety downfalls are to be recited in the Prātimokṣa Sūtra every half month, this teaches the recitation of the downfalls.

analyzed: ltung byed kyi chos zhes bya ba ni spang pa'i ltung byed dag ltar dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The term “an offense entailing confession” does not mean that, like the downfalls that require relinquishment, the object to be relinquished is confessed as an offense entailing confession.

original: spang bar bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir /

original: des na ltung byed 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i ming thob po //
analyzed: des na ltung byed 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i ming thob po //
translated: Therefore, it is called “an offense entailing confession alone.”

original: de dag nyid kha na ma tho ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kha na ma tho ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These are called “Dharma” because they bear the characteristics of a downfall.

original: dgu bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni grangs dgu bcu chad pa'i @118b bcu pa phrag dgu 'og nas 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: dgu bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni grangs dgu bcu chad pa'i @118b bcu pa phrag dgu 'og nas 'byung ba dag go //

analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: …are stated in the Prātimokṣa Sūtra that is recited every half-month.

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing gso spyod 'don pa'i tshe /
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing gso spyod 'don pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Poṣadha ceremony is recited every half-month,

analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i kha ton las 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: they are stated in the recitation of the Vinaya-dhara.

original: de la brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: de la brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The introduction to the class of offenses entailing confession for lying is as follows.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de'i tshe na mnyan yod na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na mnyan yod na /
translated: At that time,

analyzed: sh'akya'i bu'i dge slong lag brgyud ces bya ba cig 'dug pa de shin tu smra ba dang / gzhan gyi smra ba'i rjes su brtson par gnas so //

original: lho phyogs nas bram ze rig byed dang / rig byed kyi yan lag pha rol du son pa dang / yul tha dad pa na gnas pa'i bram ze rnams kyi ston par gyur pa zhig kyang bram ze'i khye'u mang po'i 'khor dang lhan cig tu mnyan yod du phyin to //
analyzed: lho phyogs nas bram ze rig byed dang / rig byed kyi yan lag pha rol du son pa dang / yul tha dad pa na gnas pa'i bram ze rnams kyi ston par gyur pa zhig kyang bram ze'i khye'u mang po'i 'khor dang lhan cig tu mnyan yod du phyin to //
translated: From the south, a brahmin who had mastered the Vedas and the Vedāṅgas, who was a teacher of many brahmins living in different countries, arrived in Śrāvastī together with a retinue of many young brahmins.

original: mnyan yod na gnas pa'i bram ze 'khor shin tu mang po dang ldan pa zhig gis de dang brtsad par brtsams pa ni /
analyzed: mnyan yod na gnas pa'i bram ze 'khor shin tu mang po dang ldan pa zhig gis de dang brtsad par brtsams pa ni /

original: rig pa'i gnas gang dang gang la gtam de 'dre bar byed pa de dang de la lho phyogs pa des mnyan yod pa 'khor dang bcas pa de dag spobs pa med par byas so //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas gang dang gang la gtam de 'dre bar byed pa de dang de la lho phyogs pa des mnyan yod pa 'khor dang bcas pa de dag spobs pa med par byas so //
translated: In whatever field of knowledge the man from the south engaged him, he would reduce the man from Śrāvastī and his retinue to silence.

analyzed: de'i tshe sh'akya'i bu dge slong lag brgyud der 'ongs pa dang / lho phyogs pa'i bram ze des smras pa /

original: kye dge slong khyod slob dpon gyi mtshan yod pas khyod ni smra ba'i khyu mchog cig yin pa 'dra na /
analyzed: kye dge slong khyod slob dpon gyi mtshan yod pas khyod ni smra ba'i khyu mchog cig yin pa 'dra na /

original: bdag la yang bla ma las yi ge cung zad blangs pa cig yod de /
analyzed: bdag la yang bla ma las yi ge cung zad blangs pa cig yod de /

original: bdag khyod dang lhan cig cung zad gtam rnam par gtan la dbab pa byed par 'dod do //
analyzed: bdag khyod dang lhan cig cung zad gtam rnam par gtan la dbab pa byed par 'dod do //

original: lag brgyud kyis smras pa /
analyzed: lag brgyud kyis smras pa /
translated: Upāli said,

analyzed: bram ze ma nyes te kho bo la yang gang du bdag gis rgol ba'i bstan bcos rnon po bya snyam pa'i blo skyes nas khyod kyang 'dir 'ongs kyis /
translated: “Brahmin, you are not at fault. I too had the thought, ‘Where can I use my sharp treatise on debate?’ and you have come here.

original: de bzhin du bya'o zhes phyi de nyin bar skyed mos tshal ga ge mo zhig tu 'gyed par dus btab po //
analyzed: de bzhin du bya'o zhes phyi de nyin bar skyed mos tshal ga ge mo zhig tu 'gyed par dus btab po //
translated: “I will do just that.” The next day, they made an appointment to meet in a certain park.

original: de'i nub mo lag brgyud kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: de'i nub mo lag brgyud kyis bsams pa /
translated: That night, Aṅgulimāla thought,

original: gal te bdag gis re zhig bram ze tshar bcad na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis re zhig bram ze tshar bcad na ni /
translated: “If I defeat the brahmin first,

original: de lta na yang bdag gis sgo 'phar brgya dag 'das te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag gis sgo 'phar brgya dag 'das te /
translated: then I will have passed by a hundred door bolts.

original: ji ltar lto dgang ba bsgrub par bya dgos so //
analyzed: ji ltar lto dgang ba bsgrub par bya dgos so //

original: gal te bram zes bdag tshar bcad na ni /
analyzed: gal te bram zes bdag tshar bcad na ni /
translated: If the brahmin defeats me,

original: de lta na bdag gi grags pa'i phreng ba med par 'gyur ro snyam nas de'i phyi de nang par rgol ba'i sar ma song ngo //
analyzed: de lta na bdag gi grags pa'i phreng ba med par 'gyur ro snyam nas de'i phyi de nang par rgol ba'i sar ma song ngo //
translated: then my garland of fame will be gone.” He did not go to the debate site the next morning.

original: de lta bu lan gnyis lan gsum tsam du 'dus pa las kyang /🔽sh'akya'i bu lag brgyud kyis de tho 'tshams pa'i phyir yul @119a * //
analyzed: de lta bu lan gnyis lan gsum tsam du 'dus pa las kyang / sh'akya'i bu lag brgyud kyis de tho 'tshams pa'i phyir yul @119a * //
translated: In this way, he did not go to the debate site for two or three days.🔽The Śākya Aṅgulimāla did not go to the debate site on purpose,

original: phyogs dang / brda dang mtshan ma byas nas ched du bsams te mi 'gro nas /
analyzed: phyogs dang / brda dang mtshan ma byas nas ched du bsams te mi 'gro nas /
translated: having made a sign and an appointment with the brahmin.

original: gzhan mu stegs can dag shes ldan dag / sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong 'di dag ni brdzun smra ba /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can dag shes ldan dag / sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong 'di dag ni brdzun smra ba /
translated: Other tīrthikas disparaged them, saying, “These monks of the Śākya’s son are liars.

original: brdzun smra ba las ma log / ma spangs /
analyzed: brdzun smra ba las ma log / ma spangs /
translated: They don’t avoid lying, they don’t abandon it,

original: so sor ma spangs pa dag yin te /
analyzed: so sor ma spangs pa dag yin te /

original: snga btus pa las yul phyogs dang / brda dang / mtshan ma byas nas ched du bsams te 'gro bar mi byed do zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: snga btus pa las yul phyogs dang / brda dang / mtshan ma byas nas ched du bsams te 'gro bar mi byed do zhes smod par byed /
translated: They criticized them,

analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: and they spread it about.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du shes bzhin du brdzun smra na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du shes bzhin du brdzun smra na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: The Blessed One then laid down a rule as before, saying, “If you lie in full awareness, you commit an offense.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni sh'akya'i bu dge slong lag brgyud /
analyzed: gang zag ni sh'akya'i bu dge slong lag brgyud /
translated: The person was the monk Śākya-bhikṣu.

original: nyon mongs pa ni gzhan la tho 'tshams pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni gzhan la tho 'tshams pa /

analyzed: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba'o //

original: de la shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In full awareness” means

analyzed: rnam par dpyad nas so //
translated: It is by means of analysis.

original: brdzun smra na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brdzun smra na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Lying

analyzed: brdzun smra ba ni rnam pa dgu yang yod /
translated: There are nine types of lying.

analyzed: rnam pa brgyad kyang yod /

original: rnam pa bdun yang yod /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun yang yod /

original: rnam pa drug kyang yod /
analyzed: rnam pa drug kyang yod /

original: rnam pa lnga yang yod /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga yang yod /
translated: There are five types.

original: rnam pa bzhi yang yod /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi yang yod /

original: rnam pa gsum yang yod /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum yang yod /
translated: There are three types.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyang yod /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyang yod /
translated: There are two types.

original: de la brdzun du smra ba rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /🔽gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas dang / tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang /
analyzed: de la brdzun du smra ba rnam pa dgu gang zhe na / gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas dang / tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang /
translated: What are the nine types of lying?

original: 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng ba'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng ba'o //
translated: They are: accusing someone of a defeating offense without having a basis; accusing someone of a serious offense; accusing someone of a minor offense; accusing someone of a downfall that needs to be confessed individually; accusing someone of a downfall that needs to be confessed to many monks; accusing someone of a downfall that needs to be confessed to a group of monks; accusing someone of a downfall that needs to be confessed to one person; accusing someone of a downfall that needs to be confessed in one’s mind; accusing someone of a downfall that needs to be confessed by a monk who has committed a serious offense.

original: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight types of lying?

original: gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o //
translated: The seven classes of offenses are: the offense entailing expulsion, the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct, the offense of wrong speech, the offense that must be confessed individually, the offense of wrongdoing, and the offense of a minor infraction.

original: rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven classes of offenses?

original: gzhi med par tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi med par tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o //
translated: They are: the offense of a monk who has violated morality, the offense of a monk who has violated view, the offense of a monk who has violated conduct, the offense of a monk who has violated livelihood, and the offense of a monk who has violated morality, view, conduct, and livelihood.

original: rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six classes of offenses?

original: dge slong brdzun du smra bar 'dod pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa dang / gzhi med par mthong ba dang /
analyzed: dge slong brdzun du smra bar 'dod pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa dang / gzhi med par mthong ba dang /
translated: They are: the offense of a monk who, desiring to lie, thinks, “I will lie,” the offense of a monk who, lying, thinks, “I am lying,” the offense of a monk who, having lied, thinks, “I have lied,” and the offense of a monk who lies without a basis.🔽What is the offense of a monk who lies without a basis?

original: thos pa dang / dogs pas brdzun du smra ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang / dogs pas brdzun du smra ba'o //
translated: It is the offense of a monk who lies without having seen, heard, or suspected anything.🔽What are the four classes of offenses?

original: rnam pa lnga gar zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga gar zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: gzhi @119b med par pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas kyis gleng ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi @119b med par pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas kyis gleng ba'o //
translated: They are: accusing someone of a defeat without a basis, accusing someone of a serious offense, accusing someone of a minor offense, accusing someone of an offense that should be confessed alone, and accusing someone of an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: gzhi med par tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi med par tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng ba'o //
translated: They are: accusing someone of a lapse in morality, a lapse in view, a lapse in conduct, or a lapse in livelihood without a basis.

original: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /

original: gzhi med par mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi med par mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas gleng ba'o //
translated: They are: accusing someone without a basis of having seen, heard, or suspected something.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the other three?

original: brdzun smra bar 'dod pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun smra bar 'dod pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smra ba na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa'o //
translated: They are: wanting to lie, thinking, “I will lie”; lying, thinking, “I am lying”; and having lied, thinking, “I have lied.”

original: rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smra'o snyam pa dang / brdzun smras pa na 'di snyam du brdzun smras so snyam pa'o //
translated: When lying, one thinks, “I am lying,” and when one has lied, one thinks, “I have lied.”

original: brdzun smra ba la rnam pa gcig pu 'ba' zhig ni med do //
analyzed: brdzun smra ba la rnam pa gcig pu 'ba' zhig ni med do //
translated: There is no lying that is not of these three types.

analyzed: brdzun smra ba ni pham par 'gyur ba yang yod /

analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba yang yod / nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba yang yod / ltung byed du 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: it may be a serious transgression of the monastic code,🔽it may be a serious offense,🔽it may be a minor offense,

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ba yang yod do //

original: de la brdzun du smra ba pham par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la brdzun du smra ba pham par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dge slong la med la med bzhin du mi'i chos bla ma smra ba'o //

analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is lying that is a serious transgression of the monastic code?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

analyzed: dge slong khros shing zhe sdang bar gyur nas /
translated: when a monk, out of anger and malice,

analyzed: ji nas kyang 'di tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam nas /
translated: thinks, “I will destroy this person’s pure livelihood,”🔽and then accuses that person of having engaged in sexual activity.

original: dge slong dag pa ltung ba med pa la gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag pa ltung ba med pa la gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: Monks, it is to groundlessly charge a pure monk with having committed an offense entailing expulsion.

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a serious transgression?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: bsgo ba rna la gzon po'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //

analyzed: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa'i ltung byed de bcu gsum pa'o /

analyzed: // / gnas mal gyi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /

original: nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhed pa dang / lha rnams la chos ston par bzhed pa dang / nad pa lta bar bzhed pa dang / gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bzhed pa'o //

translated: He wishes to remain in solitary meditation, he wishes to teach the Dharma to the gods, he wishes to visit the sick, he wishes to inspect the sleeping quarters, and he wishes to establish the bases of training for the disciples in the Vinaya.

analyzed: don 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhir bca' bar bzhed pas /

original: rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrub par mdzad do //

analyzed: bri'u 'am / stan nang tshangs can nam /
translated: “If a monk spreads out or has someone spread out a seat, a cushion, a woolen mat,

translated: “The resident monks” means

analyzed: ma bcol bar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Without asking” means

analyzed: bcol ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /

translated: “This is the temple,” “Look at the temple,” “This is the bedding,” “Gather up the bedding,” and “Lock the door”—these are the five.🔽If there are no monks, one should ask a novice monk.

analyzed: gal te dge tshul med na khyim bdag la bcol bar bya'o //

analyzed: gal te lam kar dge slong mthong na kho bos phyogs che ge mo zhig tu lde mig sbas kyis long shig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he sees a monk on the way, he should say, ‘I hid the key in such-and-such a place. Take it.’

analyzed: de nas song na zhes bya ba ni nyen kor spongs na'o //

analyzed: de'i nyen kor ni 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad de /

analyzed: de yang rtsig pa la sogs pas ma bskor ba la ni rung nyid nas so //

analyzed: bskor ba la ni sgo khang nas so //
translated: If it is surrounded, it is from the gatehouse.

analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rkyen bzhag ste'o //
translated: ‘Except in such a case’ means except if such a condition is set.

analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ‘One commits an offense entailing confession’ is as above.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the basic offense is set forth as follows.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gnas mal khri dang khri'u dang / stan nang tshangs can dang / la ba dang / sngas dang / gor bu la sogs pa gnas kyi yan lag tu gtogs pa gang yang rung ba rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par bzhag pa ma bsdus sam /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gnas mal khri dang khri'u dang / stan nang tshangs can dang / la ba dang / sngas dang / gor bu la sogs pa gnas kyi yan lag tu gtogs pa gang yang rung ba rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par bzhag pa ma bsdus sam /
translated: If a monk or a monk appointed by him leaves a bed or seat belonging to the saṅgha of monks, or any of the articles that are part of the dwelling, such as a bed, a bench, a mattress, a pillow, a woolen shawl, a blanket, a bolster, or a cushion, outside without putting it away,

original: sdud dum bcug gam /
analyzed: sdud dum bcug gam /
translated: or if he has someone else do so,

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las 'das par song na gnas mal phan phun du ma gyur kyang rung /🔽de nyid gnyid log gam /
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las 'das par song na gnas mal phan phun du ma gyur kyang rung / de nyid gnyid log gam /

original: snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: or if he enters into meditative absorption,

original: gnas mal phan phun du gyur na nyen kor las ma 'das kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gnas mal phan phun du gyur na nyen kor las ma 'das kyang rung ste /
translated: even if he does not go beyond the vicinity,

translated: he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi gnas mal nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa byas pa lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no //
translated: The basis of the offense is the bed or seat belonging to the saṅgha of monks. The act of relinquishment is performed by the monk himself or by someone appointed by him to put it away outside.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual downfall is accrued by five factors:

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas mal nyid dang rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa dang / ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol ba dang / nyen kor las 'das sam /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas mal nyid dang rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa dang / ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol ba dang / nyen kor las 'das sam /
translated: The bedding belongs to the community; it is left uncovered by oneself or by someone appointed; it is not rolled up or not rolled up for the sake of others; it is not entrusted to a monk who is present; it is left in a place that is not suitable.

original: de nyid du gnyid log gam /
analyzed: de nyid du gnyid log gam /
translated: One has fallen asleep or

analyzed: @132b snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / phan phun gsum po rlung gis bzlog gam /
translated: one has entered meditative absorption, and so forth; the three benefits are prevented by the wind;

original: char pas rim pa gzhan slebs sam /
analyzed: char pas rim pa gzhan slebs sam /
translated: the rain falls in another place;

original: sril la sogs pas rim pa bzhin slebs pa /
analyzed: sril la sogs pas rim pa bzhin slebs pa /
translated: the bedding is carried away by mice, and so forth;

original: gang byung yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gang byung yang rung ba'o //
translated: or it is carried away by any other means.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, the downfall is a serious transgression or a minor offense, depending on the circumstances.

original: gnas mal gyi ltung byed de bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi ltung byed de bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This was the fourteenth downfall.

original: // / gding ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / gding ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The downfall of spreading the bedding

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in Śrāvastī.

analyzed: bya zhing ; khyed cag kyang lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / dra ba dang / phor bu dang / ska rags dang / lung dbog pa dang / kha ton dang / bklag pa dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la byed pa dang /
translated: You should not be bothered with begging bowls, robes, water filters, water strainers, belts, giving teachings, chanting, reading, yoga, mental focus,🔽or nursing the sick.”

original: nad g-yog gis brel ba med par bya'o zhes spro bar byas pa dang / de gang gi tshe dge slong rnams kyis 'di gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa yin no zhes bya bar shes par gyur pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: nad g-yog gis brel ba med par bya'o zhes spro bar byas pa dang / de gang gi tshe dge slong rnams kyis 'di gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa yin no zhes bya bar shes par gyur pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When the monks realized that he was a person of bad character,

analyzed: bsod snyoms pa de ni gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa yin pas khyod la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro //

original: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
translated: The alms-pilgrim said,

analyzed: kho bo ni lo 'das pa yin pas kho bo de la gnas bca' ba dang / lung mnod pa dang / bklag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba'i las rag lus pa cung zad kyang med pas /

original: nye dags gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi mtshams 'das pa de'i tshe na smras pa /
analyzed: nye dags gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi mtshams 'das pa de'i tshe na smras pa /

analyzed: btsun pa nye dags ci khyod kyis sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun ma mthong ngam /

analyzed: bsod snyoms pa khyed re zhig mi khyer ba ni yus na /
translated: “You who beg for alms, you are not carrying anything, so what is the point of this?”

original: ci khyod kho bo bas kyang mkhas pa yin snyam mam /
analyzed: ci khyod kho bo bas kyang mkhas pa yin snyam mam /

analyzed: ci na khyod kho bo la de skad zer /

original: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
translated: The one who begs for alms said,

analyzed: mkhas pa ma yin yang rigs pa tsam smra'o //
translated: “I am not learned, but I am just speaking logically.”

original: nye dags bsams pa /
analyzed: nye dags bsams pa /

analyzed: bsod snyoms pa 'di mi dga' bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: “I must make this one who begs for alms unhappy.”

analyzed: de gnyis mthar gyis ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na /
translated: The two of them gradually went wandering through the countryside.

original: ri brags kyi gtsug khang zhig gi 'dab tu phyin pa na /
analyzed: ri brags kyi gtsug khang zhig gi 'dab tu phyin pa na /
translated: They came to the edge of a monastery in a mountain village.

original: gtsug lag khang der dge 'dun gyis gnas mal gyi gand'i brdungs nas bsod snyoms pa ni nang du song ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang der dge 'dun gyis gnas mal gyi gand'i brdungs nas bsod snyoms pa ni nang du song ste /
translated: The monks in that monastery were beating the gavel to assign sleeping places. The one who begs for alms went inside.

original: nye dga' dang rang gi gnas mal mnos te bsdad na /
analyzed: nye dga' dang rang gi gnas mal mnos te bsdad na /
translated: Udayi took his own sleeping place and stayed there.

analyzed: nye dga' phyi rol na 'du 'dzi'i gtam la yengs pa nam sros kyi bar du ma 'ongs nas /

original: bsod snyoms pa des khar thog tu nye dga'i mal bshams nas rkang pa'i chu dang / rkang pa bsku ba mtha' gcig tu bzhag ste /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa des khar thog tu nye dga'i mal bshams nas rkang pa'i chu dang / rkang pa bsku ba mtha' gcig tu bzhag ste /

analyzed: bdag nyid gtsug lag @136b khang gi phyi rol tu rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas /

analyzed: 'og khang du mal bshams par zhugs te nyal ba dang / ji tsam mig lam chad pa'i dus kyi tshe / nye dga' 'ongs nas sgo brdungs pa dang / bsod snyoms pas sgo ma phye bar steng du mal bshams par nyol cig ces smras so //
translated: and went to sleep on the bed he had prepared in the lower story.🔽When it was time for him to get up, Upasena came and knocked on the door. The alms-begging monk did not open the door, but said, “Sleep on the bed you have prepared on top of me.”

original: nye dga' khang thog tu 'dzegs nas rkang pa gnyis bkrus te gnas khang du zhugs nas bsod snyoms pa zhes bos pa dang / bsod snyoms pas btsun pa nye dga' ci zer zhes byas so //
analyzed: nye dga' khang thog tu 'dzegs nas rkang pa gnyis bkrus te gnas khang du zhugs nas bsod snyoms pa zhes bos pa dang / bsod snyoms pas btsun pa nye dga' ci zer zhes byas so //
translated: Upasena climbed up to the roof, washed his feet, and went into the room. He called out, “Alms-begging monk!”🔽The alms-begging monk said, “Venerable Upasena, what is it?”

original: nye dga' sgra la mkhas pas des bsod snyoms pa'i 'phral ba'i thad kar khri rkang gtad de /
analyzed: nye dga' sgra la mkhas pas des bsod snyoms pa'i 'phral ba'i thad kar khri rkang gtad de /

original: ci nas kyang khri rkang gis khang thog brtol nas bsod snyoms pa de'i dpral bar 'bab par 'gyur ba de ltar shugs drag pos mnan pa dang / des bsod snyoms pa de'i 'phral bar phog pas 'phral ba zhom mo //
analyzed: ci nas kyang khri rkang gis khang thog brtol nas bsod snyoms pa de'i dpral bar 'bab par 'gyur ba de ltar shugs drag pos mnan pa dang / des bsod snyoms pa de'i 'phral bar phog pas 'phral ba zhom mo //

original: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /

analyzed: btsun pa nye dga' kho bo gnad do kho bo gnad do //
translated: “Venerable Udayin, I’m dying! I’m dying!”

original: nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: nye dags smras pa /
translated: Udayin said,

original: kye bsod snyoms pa ci zer /
analyzed: kye bsod snyoms pa ci zer /
translated: “Hey, alms-master, what are you saying?”

original: bsod snyoms pas bsams pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pas bsams pa /
translated: The alms-master thought,

original: gal te skad phyung na 'dis rgan rims kyis khri yang phrogs par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: gal te skad phyung na 'dis rgan rims kyis khri yang phrogs par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: “If I shout, he’ll take away my bed because of my seniority.”

analyzed: de cang mi smra bar 'dug 'dug nas nang par sngar langs nas mnyan yod du song nas /
